item.title: Try harder and make notes
item.description: Step 1. Register for the course Go to [Offensive Security](https://www.offensive-security.com/ and register for the OSCP course and labs. Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step. You can register for the course at PWK OSCP Step 2. Build your own methodology I would recommend you to build your own methodology throughout the course and even after that. You could use, for example of the following:
item.content:
Step 1. Register for the course

Go to [Offensive Security](https://www.offensive-security.com/ and register for the OSCP course and labs.

Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step.

You can register for the course at PWK OSCP

Step 2. Build your own methodology

I would recommend you to build your own methodology throughout the course and even after that.

You could use, for example of the following:

  1. Use Gitbook
  2. Use Pentest WS
  3. Use Evernote
  4. Use Github

Step 3. Organize and practise

My suggestions to you are to organize and practise how you want to approacht this course but definitely remember to use:

https://www.exploit-db.com/
https://github.com/
https://www.google.com/
https://www.exploit-db.com/searchsploit
http://pentestmonkey.net/cheat-sheet/shells/reverse-shell-cheat-sheet
https://ippsec.rocks/?#
https://rana-khalil.gitbook.io/hack-the-box-oscp-preparation/
https://0xdf.gitlab.io/

Step 4. Have fun and enjoy!!

The best way to learn something is just to do it!
